author: Jake Polden
title: Brazilian hot-head Felipe Melo stands over rival player and SCREAMS in his face after he tries to beat him with a trick
text:
Felipe Melo always had a reputation for being a bit of a tough nut. 
And as the above video shows, he is still every bit the defensive enforcer he was during his days in both the Italian and Turkish leagues - if not more so. 
The video captures the Brazilian making his debut for Palmeiras in their game with Botafogo when an opposition player tries to beat him. 
Not only that, he tries to do so with an audacious little flick. And well, Melo doesn't take his attempt to show him up too kindly. Felipe Melo wins the ball with a tough tackle 
As the ball makes its way over his head, Melo turns and sprints towards it, blocking off his man. 
He goes into the challenge hard but fair - presumably so he doesn't try anything cheeky again. 
But just to be sure, Melo goes a step further by 'letting him know he's there'. 
Now anyone who has played Sunday League football will know that there are a number of ways players can let someone else 'know they're there'. Once an enforcer, always an enforcer (Photo: Dean Mouhtaropoulos) 
Melo's way is quite unique though and simply involves him standing over the fallen player and screaming in his face. 
Check the referee's reaction afterwards as he sheepishly wanders towards Melo and tells him to calm himself down... he doesn't dare issue a card. 
Well would you?
